sentences.english: And all of those hard working people down at the DMV need to be paid, too.
sentences.chinese: 那些在機動車部門勤勤懇懇工作的人也需要得到報酬。

sentences.english: These men are literally rebuilding the Sri Lankan railway.
sentences.chinese: 這些人正在勤勤懇懇地重建斯里蘭卡的鐵路。

sentences.english: He is not bright, but he always works hard.
sentences.chinese: 他並不聰明，但工作總是勤勤懇懇。
他們都是勤勤懇懇的人。

sentences.english: He enjoys the early morning. He feels good about being conscientious about his job.
sentences.chinese: 他享受清晨，爲自己勤勤懇懇的工作態度感覺良好。

sentences.english: He industriously engages in unostentatious hard work.

definition: night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
